strengths: All 3 iter-14 action items resolved in a single fix cycle: DRY violation in try-invoke.ts fixed (imports extractNumber/extractSynthesisActionItem from try-synthesize.ts), SSESender type extracted from route.ts to types.ts eliminating the reverse dependency, and 70 new tests added covering 4 previously untested modules.

Verification infrastructure reached 244 tests across 18 files -- the most comprehensive test suite yet. New coverage includes github.ts (16 tests for parseGitHubUrl, selectFiles, getTierLimits, pMap), rate-limit.ts (8 tests), panel-serializer.ts (24 tests for panelToYaml, escapeYaml), and try-prompt.ts (22 tests for buildUserPrompt, buildCrossIterationContext).

Pipeline architecture is clean and well-decomposed: route.ts (229 lines) orchestrates a linear flow through try-invoke -> try-debate -> try-revisions -> try-synthesize, with each module having single responsibility. The shared type guards in type-guards.ts (isRecord, isRepoInfo) are used across 5+ files for runtime safety.
weaknesses: try-storage.ts (254 lines) remains the last significant untested module -- it contains Upstash Redis persistence logic with error handling branches that should have integration tests.

The JSON.parse casts in try-invoke.ts (line 28) and try-synthesize.ts (line 190) still use `as Record<string, unknown>` rather than a shared parseToRecord helper combining JSON.parse with isRecord validation -- a minor but persistent pattern gap (2+ iterations).
Board builder uses `as BuilderCriterion` and `as BuilderAgent` type assertions in the reducer (boards/build/page.tsx lines 211, 259) instead of constructing objects with explicit field assignment.

action_items.action: Extract a parseToRecord helper in type-guards.ts that combines JSON.parse with isRecord validation, replacing bare `as Record<string, unknown>` casts in try-invoke.ts:28 and try-synthesize.ts:190.
action_items.impact: Eliminates the last unsafe JSON.parse pattern. Architecture score +1 toward 93.

action_items.action: Add integration tests for try-storage.ts covering saveWebReview, getPreviousReviewForRepo, and listWebReviews with mock Upstash client.
action_items.impact: Closes the last untested module gap. Verification score toward 95, test count past 260.

action_items.action: Replace type assertions in boards/build/page.tsx reducer with explicit object construction to eliminate `as BuilderCriterion` and `as BuilderAgent` casts.
action_items.impact: Simplicity +1. Type safety improvement in the board builder.

agents.one_line: All three chronic action items resolved in a single fix cycle with 70 new tests -- the pipeline is clean, verification is deep at 244 tests, and compound learning is demonstrated across 15 iterations of sustained improvement.

strengths: All 3 iter-14 action items resolved: install section in messages.ts now shows `npx boardclaude install .` (line 42), YAML preview pane added to Board Builder (boards/build/page.tsx:272-291 YamlPreview component using panelToYaml on every state change), and Install CLI link added to global nav in layout.tsx (7 locales).

The user journey from discovery to first value is now genuinely excellent: landing page HeroTrySection -> /try with zero-install 6-agent evaluation -> `npx boardclaude install .` for CLI with Install link always visible in the nav header.

The Board Builder with real-time YAML preview resolves a 5+ iteration chronic issue. Users can now see exactly how their panel configuration translates to YAML output, with useMemo for performance (line 338-341). The builder uses a clean useReducer pattern with 12 action types.
weaknesses: Score progression data on the landing page still doesn't show the full 15-iteration arc -- the static scores in messages.ts loop.progression.scores are a fixed set, not dynamically loaded from state.json.

The Try It Now flow shows evaluation results but has no clear path to 'fix and re-evaluate' -- users see action items but can't act on them without installing the CLI. A 'What to do next' section would improve conversion.

The board builder YAML preview is collapsed by default (YamlPreview line 273 collapsed=true) -- users may not discover it. An expanded-by-default or a prominent 'Preview your panel' call-to-action would increase the feature's impact.

action_items.action: Dynamically load score progression from state.json score_history in the landing page loop section instead of static values in messages.ts.
action_items.impact: Shows the real 15-iteration improvement arc. Strengthens the narrative with authentic data.

action_items.action: Add a 'What to do next' section after Try It Now results: 1) Install CLI to fix action items, 2) Build a custom board, 3) View full results history.
action_items.impact: Improves conversion from free trial to CLI adoption.

action_items.action: Default the YAML preview to expanded in the board builder, or add a prominent preview badge/indicator.
action_items.impact: Ensures the newly-added feature is discoverable. Adoption path improvement.

agents.one_line: All three chronic product blockers are finally resolved -- npx install, YAML preview, and Install nav link create a genuinely excellent path from discovery to first value, though the landing page score progression should dynamically reflect the real 15-iteration improvement arc.

strengths: Prompt caching (cache_control: { type: 'ephemeral' } in try-invoke.ts lines 175, 306) now enabled on user prompts across all 6 agents, reducing input token costs by 40-50% when agents share identical repo content. This directly resolved iter-14 P3.

Full debate exchange text now propagated through cross-iteration context via buildCrossIterationContext in try-prompt.ts (lines 101-118), including debate transcript entries and score revisions. This resolves iter-14 P4 and enables genuine compound learning across audit iterations.

BYOK file budget doubled from 400K to 800K chars (github.ts getTierLimits line 214) -- a meaningful step toward leveraging the 1M context window. Combined with the 60 source files limit for BYOK, agents now see a substantially deeper slice of large repositories.
weaknesses: CHRONIC (3+ iterations): No use of Claude Agent SDK Agent Teams primitive for parallel coordination. The web pipeline still uses custom Promise.allSettled in try-invoke.ts:415 -- functional but misses the structured coordination, built-in error handling, and team-level communication that Agent Teams provides.

The 800K char budget still uses only ~20% of the 1M context window. For repositories with 200+ files, agents only see a small fraction. The CLI pipeline uses full Agent Teams with file access, but the web pipeline remains constrained.

No adaptive effort calibration within a single audit -- all agents of the same tier get the same thinking budget. Boris evaluating a 5-file repo gets the same 10K thinking tokens as Boris evaluating a 200-file monorepo. Dynamic budget based on repo complexity would better utilize Opus capabilities.

action_items.action: Implement adaptive effort budgets based on repo complexity: scale thinking tokens proportionally to file count and total content size (e.g., 5K base + 1K per 10 files, capped at EFFORT_BUDGET_MAP max).
action_items.impact: Better utilizes Opus adaptive thinking on complex repos. opus_usage score +3-5 points.

action_items.action: Increase BYOK file budget to 1.2M chars to fully leverage the 1M token context window (1.2M chars ~ 300K tokens accounting for prompt overhead).
action_items.impact: Agents see 50%+ more repository content. opus_usage score toward 87+.

action_items.action: Add a lightweight tool_result caching layer in try-invoke.ts: if agent A already read a file, agent B can reference the cached content without a separate read_file call.
action_items.impact: Reduces redundant file reads across parallel agents. Efficiency +2 points.

agents.one_line: Prompt caching and full debate text propagation represent solid progress on efficiency and compound learning, but the system still underutilizes the 1M context window at 800K chars and lacks Agent SDK Teams for structured multi-agent coordination.

strengths: Both Suspense boundary and DRY action items from iter-14 are resolved: ResultsPage (results/page.tsx:49-51) and TimelinePage (timeline/page.tsx:221-223) now wrap async data fetching in Suspense with dedicated loading skeletons. The try-invoke.ts fallback (lines 356-403) now imports extractNumber, extractSynthesisActionItem, and extractStringArray from try-synthesize.ts.

Test coverage jumped from 174 to 244 tests (+70) with systematic coverage of previously untested modules: github.ts (16 tests), rate-limit.ts (8 tests), panel-serializer.ts (24 tests), try-prompt.ts (22 tests). All 244 tests pass with 0 TypeScript errors under strict mode.

The Board Builder (boards/build/page.tsx) demonstrates excellent pattern usage: useReducer with 12 typed actions (BuilderAction discriminated union), useMemo for YAML preview computation (line 338-341), useCallback for stable event handlers, proper template loading via useEffect with searchParams dependency.
weaknesses: JSON.parse casts still present: try-invoke.ts:28 and try-synthesize.ts:190 use `as Record<string, unknown>` after JSON.parse instead of runtime validation with isRecord. The parseToRecord helper proposed in iter-14 P2 was not implemented.

The board builder reducer at lines 211 and 259 uses type assertions (`as BuilderAgent`, `as BuilderCriterion`) when constructing updated objects. These should use explicit field assignment for full type safety.

28 occurrences of text-gray-400 remain across 14 files (down from 41 in iter-14). While many are used for intentionally lower-contrast labels and nav links, body text instances in ResultsPageClient.tsx and PanelSynthesisView.tsx should use text-gray-300 for WCAG AA compliance.

action_items.action: Extract parseToRecord helper in type-guards.ts: `function parseToRecord(text: string): Record<string, unknown> | null { try { const data = JSON.parse(text); return isRecord(data) ? data : null; } catch { return null; } }`. Replace casts in try-invoke.ts:28 and try-synthesize.ts:190.
action_items.impact: Code quality +1 point. Eliminates the last JSON.parse type safety gap.

action_items.action: Replace `as BuilderCriterion` at boards/build/page.tsx:259 and `as BuilderAgent` at line 211 with explicit object construction using spread + field override.
action_items.impact: Patterns +1 point. Removes type assertions from the builder reducer.

action_items.action: Audit remaining 28 text-gray-400 instances and replace body text occurrences with text-gray-300. Keep text-gray-400 only for nav links and labels where lower contrast is intentional.
action_items.impact: Accessibility improvement. Performance score stable, code quality +0.5.

agents.one_line: Suspense boundaries and the DRY fix are properly implemented, test coverage is exceptional at 244, and the board builder shows exemplary pattern usage -- the remaining work is extracting the parseToRecord helper and cleaning up type assertions in the reducer.

strengths: Accessibility improvements are meaningful: aria-live='polite' region added to TryPageClient.tsx (line 64) with role='status' for phase updates and agent progress announcements. Combined with existing AgentCard aria-live (line 58), screen reader users now get real-time feedback during the entire evaluation flow.

Text contrast fixes reduced text-gray-400 from 41 to 28 occurrences -- body text in key pages has been updated to text-gray-300 for WCAG AA compliance. The remaining 28 instances are mostly intentional lower-contrast elements (nav links, labels).

Install command updated to `npx boardclaude install .` in messages.ts (line 42), matching README Option 1. The landing page now promotes the correct, working install path. Community infrastructure remains genuinely complete: MIT LICENSE, CONTRIBUTING.md, SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT, issue/PR templates.
weaknesses: Still no runnable demo project in examples/ -- developers cannot clone a minimal project, audit it, fix it, and see scores improve in under 5 minutes. This has been deferred across 2 iterations due to high effort.
README screenshots don't show before/after improvement -- the score progression is BoardClaude's core value proposition but the visual proof is missing from the README.

28 text-gray-400 instances remain across 14 files. While many are intentional for decorative elements, body text instances in ResultsPageClient.tsx (4 occurrences) and results/web/[auditId]/page.tsx (5 occurrences) should be text-gray-300.

action_items.action: Add examples/demo-repo/ with a minimal project that scores ~65 and examples/demo-repo-fixed/ showing the same project at ~85 after /bc:fix. Include a README with step-by-step instructions.
action_items.impact: Examples score +5 points. Time to hands-on value drops from 10+ minutes to under 3.

action_items.action: Add a score progression screenshot or animated GIF to README.md showing the 68 -> 90 improvement arc across 15 iterations.
action_items.impact: Visual proof of the core value proposition. Documentation score +1-2 points.

action_items.action: Fix remaining body text instances of text-gray-400 in ResultsPageClient.tsx and results/web/[auditId]/page.tsx to text-gray-300.
action_items.impact: Closes the contrast issue for content text. Accessibility score toward 92.

agents.one_line: The aria-live improvements and contrast fixes make the dashboard genuinely more accessible, the install path is now correct, and community infrastructure remains complete -- but the project still needs a runnable demo-repo and a score progression screenshot to fully demonstrate its value.

strengths: aria-live='polite' region successfully added to TryPageClient.tsx (line 64) with role='status', announcing phase changes and agent progress counts. This resolves iter-14 P1 and makes the online demo usable for screen reader users -- a critical community accessibility improvement.

Install CLI link added to global nav in layout.tsx with full i18n support across all 7 locales (en/es/fr/de/ja/zh/ar). The nav now provides a persistent path from any page to CLI adoption, improving community onboarding flow.

Production readiness continues to strengthen: Suspense boundaries in ResultsPage and TimelinePage enable streaming SSR, rate limiting is dual-layer (in-memory + Upstash), error handling uses typed codes with user-friendly messages, and prompt caching reduces operational costs.
weaknesses: Keyboard shortcuts still not documented in README or dashboard UI. The focus-visible states are well-implemented but power users have no way to discover available shortcuts without inspecting the code.

No automated accessibility testing in CI pipeline -- no axe-core, no WCAG validation. Manual a11y checks are good but automation catches regressions across iterations. This has been flagged for 2+ iterations.

Timeline page uses toLocaleString('en-US') at timeline/page.tsx:190 for date formatting, which hardcodes English regardless of the user's locale. This should use Intl.DateTimeFormat with the active locale from next-intl.

action_items.action: Replace toLocaleString('en-US') in timeline/page.tsx:190 with Intl.DateTimeFormat using the active locale from next-intl to ensure dates render correctly for all 7 supported locales.
action_items.impact: Fixes locale-aware date formatting. Internationalization score +1-2 points.

action_items.action: Add axe-core to the CI pipeline or vitest test suite for automated WCAG 2.1 AA validation on key pages.
action_items.impact: Prevents accessibility regressions across iterations. Integration and community_impact +1 point each.

action_items.action: Document keyboard shortcuts in README and add a visible keyboard shortcut help modal (? key) in the dashboard.
action_items.impact: Makes accessibility features discoverable. Community impact +1 point.

agents.one_line: aria-live and the Install nav link resolve the two biggest community accessibility gaps, i18n remains production-grade at 100% coverage, and integration continues to strengthen with Suspense SSR -- but the hardcoded en-US date format and missing automated a11y testing need attention.

top_strengths: All chronic action items from iter-14 resolved in a single fix cycle: DRY violation fixed (try-invoke.ts imports shared validators), SSESender extracted to shared types, YAML preview pane added, Install nav link added, npx install command updated, Suspense boundaries implemented (Boris, Cat, Lydia)

Test coverage reached 244 tests across 18 files (+70 from iter-14), systematically covering 4 previously untested modules (github.ts, rate-limit.ts, panel-serializer.ts, try-prompt.ts) -- the most comprehensive test suite in the project's history (Boris, Lydia)

Accessibility improvements are genuine and impactful: aria-live on /try page for screen reader users, text contrast fixes (41 -> 28 text-gray-400), Install link in global nav across 7 locales, Suspense boundaries for streaming SSR (Ado, Jason, Lydia)
Board Builder with real-time YAML preview (useMemo + panelToYaml) resolves a 5+ iteration chronic issue, with clean useReducer pattern and 12 typed actions (Cat, Lydia)
top_weaknesses: CHRONIC (3+ iterations): No Claude Agent SDK Agent Teams for web pipeline parallel coordination -- still using custom Promise.allSettled in try-invoke.ts (Thariq)
JSON.parse casts (`as Record<string, unknown>`) persist in try-invoke.ts and try-synthesize.ts -- parseToRecord helper not extracted despite being flagged for 2 iterations (Boris, Lydia)
No runnable demo project in examples/ for hands-on experience -- deferred due to high effort (Ado)
No automated accessibility testing in CI (axe-core) -- flagged for 2+ iterations (Jason)
28 text-gray-400 instances remain across 14 files, though reduced from 41 (Ado, Lydia)

divergent_opinions.topic: Overall project maturity and AI capability usage
divergent_opinions.analysis: Five agents scored composites of 91-92 (STRONG_PASS) while Thariq scored 83.95 (PASS). The gap reflects Thariq's AI innovation lens: the system is excellently engineered but doesn't fully leverage Opus 4.6's 1M context window (using ~20% at 800K chars) or the Agent SDK Teams primitive. From an engineering perspective the project is A-grade; from an AI capability perspective there's meaningful room to push the frontier.

agent_a.position: Highest scorer at 92.05 -- community impact, i18n, and integration are genuinely production-grade.

agent_b.position: Lowest scorer at 83.95 -- the system doesn't leverage Agent SDK Teams or the full 1M context window, limiting its AI innovation ceiling.
